fields.title: I am a wonderful and unique creation
The parts of the human body and their functions
Caring for the parts of my body
Keeping my body healthy by eating good food and taking my vaccination
Protecting ourselves from home and road accidents
Types and members of my family
Origin and History of my Family

fields.description: Demonstrate the understanding that all learners are wonderful and have unique body features that make them different from other people and other God's creation in the environment.
Demonstrate the understanding of appropriate names of the parts of the body and describe the functions of each part.
Demonstrate understanding of the importance of personal hygiene and how to care for my body parts e.g. hand, feet finger nails-washing, face washing, nose
Demonstrate the understanding that eating good food and taking all my childhood vaccinations will keep me growing healthy and strong.
Demonstrate understanding of how keeping our home and school environment clean can keep us healthy and strong.
Identify and talk in simple sentences, about the features of our body that make us unique and different from other God's creation. E.g. animals
Sing an action song that helps learners name the parts of the body and point to them
Recognize and talk about the different parts of book, (the front/ cover page of a book and back of a book) and relate the content of the text to our body parts.
Using a conversation poster of body parts, learners talk about the functions of the parts of the human body that we can see.
Sing songs and recite rhymes about how we take care of each part of the body and demonstrate how to do it. e.g. This is the way we wash our face...

fields.title: Body Parts Identification Game
fields.brief_description: Interactive game using pictures and songs to help learners identify and appreciate their unique body features
fields.steps_to_make:
1. Prepare picture cards of different body parts
2. Create a simple song about body parts
3. Set up a circle for learners to sit
4. Prepare a ball for the passing game
fields.tips_for_use: Use positive language throughout the activity. Encourage all learners to participate. Model the description first before asking learners to do so.
fields.learning_outcome: Learners will be able to identify and describe their unique body features using positive language
fields.search_keywords: body parts, self-awareness, uniqueness, identity, KG1

fields.title: Body Functions Action Poster
fields.brief_description: Large conversational poster showing body parts and their functions with interactive elements
fields.steps_to_make:
1. Draw or paste pictures of body parts on large manila card
2. Add arrows pointing to each part
3. Write simple function descriptions
4. Laminate for durability
5. Add velcro strips for interactive elements
fields.tips_for_use: Point to each body part while explaining its function. Have learners demonstrate the functions. Use both local language and English.
fields.learning_outcome: Learners will understand and explain the functions of different body parts
fields.search_keywords: body functions, poster, visual aid, interactive, KG1

fields.title: Personal Hygiene Song and Dance
fields.brief_description: Musical activity combining songs, rhymes and dance movements to teach body care habits
fields.steps_to_make:
1. Prepare lyrics for hygiene songs
2. Create simple dance movements for each verse
3. Practice the song rhythm
4. Prepare props if needed (pretend soap, toothbrush)
fields.tips_for_use: Start with familiar tunes. Repeat the songs multiple times. Encourage all learners to participate in movements. Connect songs to real hygiene practices.
fields.learning_outcome: Learners will demonstrate proper hygiene practices through song and movement
fields.search_keywords: hygiene, songs, dance, body care, habits, KG1

fields.name: Dyslexia
fields.description: Difficulty reading and decoding words

fields.name: ADHD
fields.description: Attention deficit, trouble focusing

fields.name: Visual Impairment
fields.description: Low vision or blindness

fields.name: Hearing Impairment
fields.description: Partial or full hearing loss

fields.name: Autism Spectrum
fields.description: Neurodiverse needs related to interaction and focus

fields.name: Other
fields.description: Any other learning need not listed

fields.name: Visual
fields.description: Prefers diagrams, images, charts

fields.name: Auditory
fields.description: Learns better through listening

fields.name: Kinesthetic
fields.description: Prefers hands-on activities

fields.name: Read/Write
fields.description: Learns best through reading and writing

fields.name: Multimodal
fields.description: Uses a combination of learning styles

fields.title: Knowing the special places in our local community
Knowing the important people/occupation in our community
Knowing the special leaders in our community
History and celebration of Ghana's Independence
Connecting and communicating with the global community

fields.description: Demonstrate understanding of measures to take to keep safe (from accidents, hurts, and harms).
Demonstrate understanding of the importance, roles and responsibilities of family members.
Demonstrate knowledge of the origin and history of our families.
Demonstrate knowledge of celebrations and festivals that the individual families celebrate.
Demonstrate understanding of the rules and regulations that governs the members of the school.
Demonstrate understanding of the good manners that our families values and why they value them.
Demonstrate understanding of the virtues, good manners and behaviour patterns our community values and why.
Demonstrate understanding of the religious and moral values and virtues we need to exhibit as good Christians and Muslims.
Demonstrate understanding of and relating well with people with different beliefs.
Demonstrate understanding of the special places in our local communities.
Use new and positive expressions/vocabulary related to the parts of the body
Sing songs about the body parts and the letters of the alphabet and clap hands on the rhythm of the songs
Draw a beautiful picture of themselves and scribble freely underneath the picture paper
Create sets of human parts that are similar and represent them with numbers up to 5.
Use visual information to aid comprehension before, during and after reading a text on functions of the parts of the human body.
Learn and use new vocabulary related to what they do with the parts of the body
Count the number of the names of the body parts in songs through clapping on the rhythm
Watch a short video clip and talk about how to care for the various parts of the body.
Talk about what we use in caring for the human body in our everyday life as they listen to a read aloud text.
Learners talk about different types of food they eat at home and classify those that can make them grow healthy.

fields.title: Number Matching with Body Parts
fields.brief_description: Counting and matching activity using body parts to teach numbers 1-5
fields.steps_to_make:
1. Collect bottle tops and pebbles
2. Create number cards 1-5
3. Draw body parts in sets
4. Prepare matching game area
fields.tips_for_use: Start with smaller numbers. Use real body parts first, then move to pictures. Encourage counting aloud.
fields.learning_outcome: Learners will count and match body parts with correct numbers up to 5
fields.search_keywords: counting, numbers, body parts, matching, KG1, numeracy

fields.title: Healthy Food Classification Activity
fields.brief_description: Hands-on activity to classify foods into the six food groups for healthy eating
fields.steps_to_make:
1. Collect real food items or pictures
2. Create six large circles for food groups
3. Label each circle with food group name
4. Prepare classification cards
fields.tips_for_use: Use real foods when possible. Discuss why each food belongs in its group. Connect to foods learners eat at home.
fields.learning_outcome: Learners will classify foods into appropriate food groups and understand healthy eating
fields.search_keywords: nutrition, food groups, health, classification, KG1

fields.title: Digital Body Care Video and Discussion
fields.brief_description: Interactive video lesson on body care followed by discussion and demonstration
fields.steps_to_make:
1. Prepare age-appropriate video on body care
2. Create discussion questions
3. Set up viewing area
4. Prepare demonstration materials
fields.tips_for_use: Pause video for discussions. Encourage questions. Follow up with real demonstrations. Connect to daily routines.
fields.learning_outcome: Learners will understand and demonstrate proper body care practices
fields.search_keywords: hygiene, video, digital, body care, demonstration, KG1

fields.description: Demonstrate knowledge of the people in the community and their occupation.
Demonstrate understanding and knowledge of the special leaders and their roles in our communities.
Demonstrate knowledge of the history and independence of Ghana
Demonstrate understanding of living and non-living things.
Demonstrate understanding of domestic and wild animals.
Demonstrate understanding of sources of water and its uses.
Demonstrate understanding of the presence of air and tell its importance.
Demonstrate understanding of the parts of plants and their functions.
Demonstrate understanding of how plants grow
Demonstrate understanding of the types of soil.
Talk about possible accidents we can have at home and at school and safety measures we can take to avoid them.
Recognize that spoken words are represented in written language in books.
Listen to and respond to a read aloud text about keeping safe in the environment.
Discuss different types of family they have at home, their roles and responsibilities
Demonstrate that print matches with illustration in a book.
Listen and tell stories about origin and history of their family members
Talk about some special family days and activities e.g. birthdays, naming, festivals, etc.
Talk about the members of the school, activities they do and create rules and regulations that should govern their classroom.
identify the good manners our families value and how it can change our personal likes and dislikes.
Talk about some important cultural values and good manners that promote respect and politeness

fields.title: I am a wonderful and unique creation
Parts of the body that we cannot see (internal) and parts of the body that we can see (external) and their functions
Personal hygiene and caring for the parts of the body
Eating good food and taking my vaccinations to keep my body healthy
Protecting ourselves from road accidents and harmful strangers
Types and members of my family
My family: Our origin and history
My school family Rules and Regulations for Learners and Teachers at school

fields.description: Demonstrate the understanding that all learners are wonderful and have unique body features that make them different from other people and other God's creation in the environment.
Demonstrate the knowledge of appropriate names of the parts of the internal body that we cannot see and their functions
Demonstrate understanding of personal hygiene and care of the human body.
Demonstrate the understanding and knowledge of keeping our bodies healthy by eating good food and visiting the hospital when sick
Demonstrate understanding of the environment and how to keep it safe
Demonstrate understanding of the sources of light for day and night.
Demonstrate understanding of changing weather conditions and seasons.
Demonstrate understanding of different ways we connect and communicate with the global world.
Visit and talk about some special places in our community
Talk about who the neighbours are, the work they do and how important their profession are in the community.
Talk about and describe the traditional and religious leaders in our community.
locate their home regions on an outline map of Ghana and talk about the history behind their festivals.
Talk about different types of things around us and classify them into living things and non-living things
Sing and talk about different kinds of animals, what they eat, the sound they make and put them into groups.
Talk about where we get water from and its uses.
Share their understanding and describe the presence of air through experimentation.
Sing and talk about parts of a plants and their functions
Talk about and discuss how plants and what human should do to enhance the growth process

fields.title: Community Places Field Trip Guide
fields.brief_description: Structured field trip activity to explore special places in the local community with observation guide
fields.steps_to_make:
1. Create observation checklist for field trip
2. Prepare permission letters for parents
3. Contact community places in advance
4. Design post-trip discussion questions
5. Prepare safety guidelines
fields.tips_for_use: Visit places beforehand. Ensure safety protocols. Encourage questions during visit. Connect to learners' experiences.
fields.learning_outcome: Learners will identify and describe special places in their community and their importance
fields.search_keywords: community, field trip, places, local, observation, KG1

fields.title: Community Helpers Role Play Center
fields.brief_description: Dramatic play center with costumes and props for learners to role-play different community occupations
fields.steps_to_make:
1. Collect or make costumes for different professions
2. Create job-related props and tools
3. Set up different stations for each profession
4. Prepare role cards with job descriptions
5. Create evaluation rubric
fields.tips_for_use: Rotate learners through different roles. Encourage authentic actions. Connect to real community workers. Discuss importance of each job.
fields.learning_outcome: Learners will understand and demonstrate knowledge of different community occupations and their importance
fields.search_keywords: occupations, role play, community helpers, dramatic play, KG1

fields.title: Living vs Non-Living Sorting Game
fields.brief_description: Interactive sorting activity using real objects and pictures to classify living and non-living things
fields.steps_to_make:
1. Collect variety of real objects (living and non-living)
2. Create picture cards as backup
3. Make two large sorting circles
4. Label circles 'Living' and 'Non-Living'
5. Prepare discussion questions
fields.tips_for_use: Start with obvious examples. Discuss characteristics of living things. Use real objects when possible. Encourage reasoning for choices.
fields.learning_outcome: Learners will correctly classify objects as living or non-living and explain their reasoning
fields.search_keywords: living things, non-living, classification, sorting, nature, KG1

fields.title: Animal Sounds and Counting Game
fields.brief_description: Musical counting game combining animal sounds, movements, and number recognition up to 10
fields.steps_to_make:
1. Create animal picture cards
2. Prepare number cards 1-10
3. Record or prepare animal sounds
4. Create movement cards for each animal
5. Set up game area
fields.tips_for_use: Start with familiar animals. Encourage mimicking sounds and movements. Count animals in groups. Connect to Old MacDonald song.
fields.learning_outcome: Learners will count, group animals, and demonstrate understanding of animal characteristics through sounds and movements
fields.search_keywords: animals, counting, sounds, music, movement, domestic, wild, KG1

fields.description: Identify and describe in simple sentences (using home language), the wonderful features of our body that make us unique and different from other God's creation, e.g. animals.
Using a conversational poster of body parts, learners talk about the parts of the human body that we can see and cannot see.
Learners use simple language to describe and engage in conversation about how to care for different part of their bodies.
Talk about how to keep our bodies healthy by eating balanced meal and visiting the hospital for our vaccinations.
Take a walk in the environment, discuss and point to things that are safe and unsafe to play with.
